sorular.soru: In which scenario are you driving on the correct part of the road?

feedback.metin: Temporary yellow lines are often painted on the road surface during roadworks. These temporary lines are above the white lines. In the situation on the left, you are driving between the white lines, which is incorrect. In the situation on the right, you are correctly driving between the yellow lines. You must ignore the white lines in these situations.

sorular.soru: Which sign should not be passed?

feedback.metin: Sign L-8 indicates a dead end. You can easily pass this sign, this is not a closed declaration. Sign L-51 indicates a bicycle street. This road can also be entered by cars. However, you need to be extra alert for cyclists and adjust your speed accordingly. Sign L-205 warns of a bus lock. You cannot pass this lock by car because you will get stuck. Therefore it is better not to drive past this sign.

sorular.soru: In which situation is it allowed to overtake on the right side?

feedback.metin: Both situations on the right are correct. A tram may be overtaken on both the left and the right. Overtaking on the right side of the block marking is also allowed, if the vehicle you are overtaking is driving on the left side of that marking. Overtaking on the right side is not allowed in both left situations. In the upper left situation you may not overtake a vehicle that is driving on the left lane unnecessary, you must wait for it to go back to the right lane. In the bottom left situation you are driving on a rush hour lane. You must consider this a normal lane. Overtaking on the right is not allowed, unless there is a traffic jam. This is not the case.

sorular.soru: Which sign warns of a poor road surface?

feedback.metin: Sign J-1 warns of a poor road surface. Sign J-25 warns against loose chippings and is used, among other things, when the road surface has just been renewed and has been scattered with gravel. Sign J-38 warns of a speed bump.
